result.execSummary:
The defendant William Edward Frith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Edward Frith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court in trial. Case spun to Br. 45. FILES FORWARDED.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per agent request, case adjourned for Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30 pm.
Bail refund check packet.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $ 17 witness fees for witness Thomas M. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213417 in court 1x on 8/31/15.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 40.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.    Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.
Clerk:  jms

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Violent Contact order, but ordered that the defendant and the victim may NOT co-habitat together.

Defendant William Edward Frith in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Check Packet
$1000.00 bail to be returned.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William Edward Frith
Current: 2849 S. 13th Street, Milwuakee, WI 53215   (Effective: 05-19-2015)
Prior: 9148 West Chester Street #7, Milwuakee, WI 53214
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas M., William A., Patrick L. or the address 9148 W. Chester Street

Defendant William Edward Frith in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.40  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/19/15 @ 1:30pm
